title: Recursive System Post-Mortem
description: Recursive synthesis of Phase 5 research arc (M45-M49), producing a coherent system-level insight about reasoning, verification, and error detection.
thesis: Self-correction fails not because models 'cannot reason,' but because generation lacks a state-comparison operator. Verification behavior is trainable as form, but not as function. Error detection succeeds when architecturally separated from generation.

m45_curriculum_reasoning.key_finding: Curriculum ordering changes reasoning structure (25% loss improvement)

m47_error_correction_fidelity.key_finding: Verification is structural, not causal (0% error detection)

m48_reasoning_failure_topology.key_finding: Ritual verification at 97-100%; lack of state-difference operator

claims_made: Error detection is separable from generation
A simple observer can detect what generators cannot

outputs.phase5_timeline.md: Milestone-by-milestone Q&A table with key metrics
outputs.architecture_diagram.md: Mermaid diagrams showing failure and success points
outputs.analysis.md: Full synthesis explaining why self-correction fails and what works instead

framing: We asked a sequence of precise questions, falsified some intuitive ideas, and arrived at a clearer architectural understanding of reasoning systems.
